author: Phil Steele
title: Keep riding the Cardinals against winded Steelers
text:
Football expert Phil Steele is the owner and publisher of Phil Steele’s College Football Preview, regarded as the college football bible. Get in-depth coverage of college and pro football 24/7/365 at PhilSteele.com . 
Cardinals (-3¹/₂) over STEELERS: The Cardinals have been a frequent flyer in the “Steele Trap” as Las Vegas continues to undervalue the talent Bruce Arians has at his disposal. All Arizona has done so far is outscore its opponents by a combined 100 points thanks in part to a rejuvenated Carson Palmer and Larry Fitzgerald and a playmaking defense that has forced 13 turnovers. These trends could pan out well this week against a Steelers squad (still without Ben Roethlisberger) that is off a short week following a last-second win at San Diego on Monday night.
Bengals (-3) over BILLS: The Bengals have proved to be pretty resilient so far in their 5-0 start, including a come-from-behind win a week ago against Seattle (trailed 24-7 in the fourth quarter). Buffalo has alternated wins with losses. While the Bills do have the home-field edge, keep in mind that injuries to some key members of their offense (Tyrod Taylor, Sammy Watkins, LeSean McCoy and Karlos Williams) has seen them in a downward spiral following a 209 total yard performance a week ago.
Last week: 2-0, Season: 8-2
